page.title: 04Shobrooke Church
page.content: The church was built in 1060 but it has been rebuilt in parts. The church is called St Swithen. It has nine stained glass windows. The church has six bells in the tower. The church organ was given by the Shelley family. Sir John Shelley was the church warden. About 24 people worship at the church on a Sunday. The church also has a grave yard. The oldest grave stone was built in 1600. The most unusual grave was made of slate, it was also built on the side of the church, it had a poem about a brother and sister on it. Reverent Arthur has christened 25 to 30 people and married 25 couples and buried 120 people. The church is mainly made of granite and sandstone. The Rev. Arthur used to work at the church. He lives at 17 Park Rd in Crediton.
